title: Jobâ€™s Plea to God
summary: Job turns from addressing Eliphaz to speaking directly to God. He laments the brevity and misery of life, and questions why God is watching and testing him so closely. He feels targeted and wonders why he was born.

faq.question: What tone does Job take toward God?
faq.answer: One of deep anguish and honest questioning, even accusing.

faq.question: What central question does Job ask God?
faq.answer: Why are You so concerned with me, a mere man, and why not forgive my sin?
